alert.note: Alert for Davison; Douglas (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 12:58PM MDT until July 05 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM CDT FOR DAVISON...SANBORN...AURORA...EASTERN JERAULD...SOUTHWESTERN MINER...DOUGLAS...HANSON...NORTHWESTERN HUTCHINSON AND SOUTHEASTERN BRULE COUNTIES... At 156 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Forestburg to near Mount Vernon to near Aurora Center, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. At 135 PM CDT, a 65 mph wind gust was reported 8 miles north of Plankinton. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Mitchell and Loomis around 200 PM CDT. Corsica and Artesian around 205 PM CDT. Armour around 215 PM CDT. Ethan and Dimock around 220 PM CDT. Parkston, Delmont and Fulton around 225 PM CDT. Alexandria, Milltown and Farmer around 230 PM CDT. Emery around 240 PM CDT. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
